title: Top Phone Sales Representative / PHONE CLOSER!!! / Work from home!
description:
Premier real estate investment firm seeking a super sharp, rock star negotiation specialist that can produce results and close deals over the phone.

Employment Type: Full Time

Compensation: $60,000 to $150,000 ++ Annually (commission based)

Here's who you are: Detail oriented, diligent, reliable, incredibly friendly ,so friendly it would be hard to stop speaking with you! Driven by commission and the need to close a sale. Intuitively good with numbers and basic accounting, but no accounting degree necessary. Previous lead and database management experience a plus. You should be comfortable with technology and able to pick up new systems quickly!

Roles and Responsibilities:

✦ Talk to Sellers over the Phone and negotiate to Buy the Property

✦ Build rapport with the sellers to overcome objections to get the deal signed

✦ Make calls to develop new leads

✦ Must be able to manage leads and follow up with prospects.

✦ Must be driven and have the mindset to want more financially

✦ Must use the CRM daily to update and stay on task until deals are closed

**Qualifications:**

✦ Proven track record of successful negotiations with sellers

✦ Ability to keep a job and meet or exceed sales goals

✦ Reliable vehicle to drive to and from appointments

✦ Confidence talking to someone you are meeting the first time like you have been lifelong friends

**Here's what the ideal candidate would look like:**

A professional, sharp dresser that understands success comes through hard work and tenacity. This person is teachable and always trying to improve themselves by reading books, watching videos, reading blogs or whatever mean necessary. This candidate is a fast starter and is extremely money motivated who is looking for the right opportunity to use their people skills and talents to build a lasting career with a great company.

This person doesn’t whine or make excuses, point fingers or lay blame, they get results and are proud of it

**About LIghtning Capital House Buyers**

For every 100 homes that are sold in United States about 5 of them do not follow the traditional “list it with a Realtor” route. The reasons for this are varied – property not inhabitable, estate property, property has not been remodeled in many years and is in poor condition, must sell fast, inherited property, tired landlord, crappy tenants, etc. The list goes on and on. These are motivated sellers with problem properties.

Believe it or not THOUSANDS homes and sellers have these issues in the US, and THOUSANDS homes are sold every year across the country that are not listed by a Realtor. Lightning Capital House Buyers mission is simple: create value for as many of these motivated sellers as possible by buying their home and helping them MOVE FORWARD to the next stage of their life.

Lightning Capital House Buyers was founded in 2017 in order to buy homes from these folks who don’t want to list with a Realtor. We are not Realtors. We are real estate investors. Since then we have bought, renovated, and sold over 200 homes in Tampa Bay. We’re pretty good at this business.

Today we have three lines of business:

We buy homes from motivated sellers and resell them to other investors.

We buy homes, renovate them, and resell them to retail buyers.

We buy homes for our rental portfolio.  
**-----------------------------------**  
**What You Should Do Next**  
**-----------------------------------**

Because there are hundreds potential applicants for a position like this we have set up a 3 Step Interview Process to allow the cream of the crop to rise to the top. Part of our selection process will be finding someone that will step out of their comfort zone and will go the extra mile. If one of these steps are not completed than your application and resume will be discarded. So please read carefully as following detailed instructions is a requirement for the position.

**Step #1** in the application process will be completing the survey by clicking the link below.

https://forms.gle/McoziWrLAedaeKTo7

**Step #2** in the application process will be testing your phone skills out with a role playing call and interview with the manager

**Step #3** in the interview process will be a combination of Zoom / in person interviews with the CEO

**INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.**

title: Remote Inside Sales Account Executive
description:
We are seeking a Remote Inside Sales Account Executive to be an integral part of our fully remote sales team in the fast-growing and stable senior living industry. As a Remote Inside Sales Account Executive, you will play a crucial role in driving revenue growth. You'll have the chance to work with pre-screened inbound leads and conduct outbound follow-up calls, engaging in consultative sales within the senior living industry.

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Salary starting at $51,500 + uncapped monthly commission plan. Total on target earnings range from $85,000-$100,000 first year but higher in year 2+.
* $1500 sign-on bonus.
* Full benefits package.
* Fully remote work opportunity.
* Opportunities for career growth and advancement in a rapidly growing industry.

**Qualifications:**

* Prior experience in funeral sales director, senior living sales, or small to medium-sized business service sales is preferred but not required.
* Experience in making 30+ calls per day is highly desirable.
* Motivated, results-driven, and able to thrive in a fast-paced sales environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively within a team while also being self-motivated.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Effectively manage and convert inbound leads into sales opportunities.
* Conduct outbound calls to prospects, showcasing our services and value proposition.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with potential clients through consultative selling.
* Achieve and exceed monthly sales targets through a combination of base salary and uncapped commissions.
* Utilize your communication and negotiation skills to close deals and contribute to the overall success of the team.

title: Behavioral Healthcare Sales Representative
description:
Join Our Remote Sales Team and Make a Difference in Behavioral Healthcare!

Are you a driven and compassionate sales professional with a passion for behavioral healthcare? Intervention 911, a leading provider of coaching and educational programs, is seeking dedicated Sales Representatives to join our remote commission-based sales team. This is an exceptional opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of our company while making a positive impact on individuals seeking to advance their careers in behavioral health care.

**About Us:**

Intervention 911 is a trusted provider of coaching and educational programs in the behavioral healthcare industry. We are committed to empowering individuals and organizations with the knowledge and skills needed to excel in their careers. As a Sales Representative, you will play a crucial role in promoting our programs and helping clients further their professional development.

**Job Description:**

As a Behavioral Healthcare Sales Representative, you will be responsible for connecting with potential clients, understanding their needs, and effectively promoting our coaching and educational programs. Your goal will be to build lasting relationships and guide clients toward the programs that best align with their career aspirations and growth objectives.

**Responsibilities:**

* Identify and reach out to potential clients in the behavioral healthcare industry.
* Conduct thorough needs assessments to understand clients' career development goals.
* Present and explain the value and benefits of our coaching and educational programs.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with clients through effective communication and follow-up.
* Collaborate with our team to ensure a seamless enrollment process and client satisfaction.
* Stay updated on industry trends and advancements to provide informed recommendations to clients.
* Meet or exceed sales targets while maintaining a high level of professionalism and integrity.

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in sales and cold calling is required.
* Strong understanding of the behavioral healthcare field and its professional development needs.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build rapport with clients.
* Self-motivated and results-driven, with the ability to work independently.
* Strong organizational skills to manage leads, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.
* Proficiency in using sales tools and CRM software to track leads and manage customer data.
* We are currently not accepting candidates from California.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive commission-based compensation structure with uncapped earning potential.
* Flexible remote work arrangement, allowing you to work from anywhere.
* Opportunity to make a positive impact in the behavioral healthcare industry.
* Ongoing training and professional development opportunities to enhance your sales skills and industry knowledge.
* Collaborative and supportive team environment.
* Join a company committed to improving the lives of individuals in the behavioral healthcare field.

Ready to make a difference in the behavioral healthcare industry while advancing your sales career? Apply now to join our remote Sales Team at Intervention 911.

Job Type: Full-time

* Monday to Friday

title: Inside Sales Representative
description:
**Company Description**  

SGS is the global leader and innovator in inspection, verification, testing and certification services. Founded in 1878, SGS is recognized as the global benchmark in quality and integrity. With over 97,000 employees in 130 countries and operating a network of more than 2,400 offices and laboratories, we provide services to almost every industry by assuring quality and safety of products and services.  

  

Trusted all over the world, SGS is a market leader because we put 100% passion, pride and innovation into everything we do. We encourage new ideas. We welcome people who challenge the way we do things. And we will be 100% committed to helping you reach your full potential.

 **Job Description**  

The Inside Sales Representative manages inbound sales and marketing leads and achieving sales targets in a designated territory. They are responsible for account management, increasing sales within existing account base and executing marketing and communication initiatives in the North American marketplace (NAM).

* Solicits, qualifies, and closes new business to target for designated region, sector and/or customer base.
* Coordinates with VP Marketing, NAM to strategize and deliver successful marketing and communication initiatives with the goal of driving lead generation to target.
* Collaborates with management and customer care team to deliver excellent service to customers.
* Collaborates with sales management and sales representatives to figure strategic sales methods.
* Manages sales and marketing leads, tracking through customer relations management (CRM) system.
* Tracks, manages, and reports sales team metrics.
* Partners with the Operations team in completing special projects focused on sales process improvement.
* Prepares proposals, renewal contracts and Proposal Work Sheets for Sales function.
* Attends sales group meetings focused on sales targets or forecasts, reporting on market situation, RFP requests, etc.
* Aids field sales staff in handling various tactical responsibilities, including trade shows and conferences.
* Promotes world class service and brand image.
* Adheres to internal standards, policies, and procedures.
* Performs other duties as assigned.
* Supervises others: Indirectly only, may provide Inspector oversight.

  

**Qualifications** **Education and Experience**

* Associate degree **AND** 3+ years of sales experience

**OR**

* High school diploma or equivalent **AND** 5+ years’ experience in the Certification Services industry

**Knowledge/ Skills/ Abilities**

* Language Skills: English – Intermediate level - ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, procedure manuals. Ability to write and interpret routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers and employees of the organization.
* Mathematical Skills: Intermediate level – ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume.
* Reasoning Skills/Abilities: Intermediate Skills – ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to resolve problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.
* Advanced communication skills
* Strong customer service focus
* Ability to work well with others & independently.
* Time management skills and a strong attention to detail
* Ability to work well under pressure.

**Computer Skills**

* MS Office (Word, Excel) – Intermediate user proficiency
* Experience using Salesforce CRM system.

**Travel**

* Travels up to 5% of the time.

  

**Additional Information**  

SGS is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and as such we recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristics protected by law.


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodations. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required.


This job description should not be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements, but a general description of the job. Nothing contained herein restricts the company’s rights to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.


If you are applying for a position within the United States and you have difficulty completing the on-line employment application because of a disability, please call 201-508-3149 for assistance and leave a message. You will receive a call back. Please note, this phone number is not for general employment information, but is only for individuals who are experiencing difficulty applying for a position due to a disability.

title: Director, Call Center Sales
description:
**Director, Call Center Operations**
====================================

Position Overview:


At Bloom, we are dedicated to revolutionizing the insurance industry through innovation and excellence. We are seeking an experienced and dedicated leader who will be responsible for the execution of all operations of the Bloom Call Center including but not limited to: staffing, scheduling, training, implementation and ongoing success of client campaigns, ensuring compliance and quality standards are achieved while keeping an eye on the bottom line by managing revenue and expenses.


### **We are looking for an exceptional individual who can:**


* Liaise with other Call Center Directors and corporate functions.
* Drive success through increased sales close ratios.
* Lead the Call Center Operations team to implement new campaigns and manage existing campaigns to meet and exceed client satisfaction.
* Support the implementation of best practice processes and procedures to ensure efficient and successful management of client campaigns.
* Monitor data to identify trends and ensure KPIs and campaign goals are being met/implementing action plans if they are not; implement course corrections where necessary.
* Ensure campaigns are staffed at appropriate levels to meet regulatory service level requirements/liaise with HR on hiring needs.
* Ensure all staff have appropriate training and licensing as required to meet regulatory requirements and to ensure operational success.
* Ensure call center employees are working to agreed quality and compliance standards.
* Serve as an internal and external escalation point in case of ongoing issues relating to Call Center operations, liaising with internal departments as needed to ensure resolution.
* Interface with clients and prospective clients as required.
* Assist the Sales and Client Services teams as needed to secure current and new business.
* Identify new revenue streams for existing campaigns in coordination with sales.
* Monitor and control expenses vs revenue, achieving maximum billing.
* Report trends, issues, and successes to management team.
* Perform all other duties as assigned.

### **Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field required
* 8+ years’ experience with managing or leading a team in call center/operations required
* Proven leadership experience
* Experience communicating to Executive Level leadership
* Knowledge of the healthcare industry an advantage (Medicare/Marketplace) preferred


Required Skills and Abilities


* Strong organizational skills required
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Excellent computer skills, e.g. Microsoft Office Suite
* Exceptional leadership skills
* Project implementation knowledge
* Analytic/Systematic Thinking
* Ability to work in a fast paced, high pressure environment
* Ability to work independently and with a team
* Ability to manager change successfully


What We Offer


Bloom operates with a people-first culture, which means listening to our employees to provide the benefits that mean the most to them. Our competitive compensation, comprehensive health coverage, long-term growth opportunities, and remote work environment are among the reasons that many of our employees have been with us since the beginning of our business. BeBloom™, our proprietary employee training and engagement program, helps you learn our business model and immerse yourself in everything our culture has to offer from day 1. From virtual live events to mentorship and leadership programs and employee-led councils, there are countless opportunities to get involved, build connections, and share your voice – because at Bloom, the **real** you belongs here.


Core Values:


* **Put People First:** Uphold and promote a people-first culture within the organization, emphasizing empathy, kindness, and a commitment to making a positive difference.


* **Be Stronger Together:** Embrace a team player mentality, leveraging the strengths of yourself and others to collaborate as one team.


* **Do What’s Right:** Adhere to high ethical standards, acting with integrity to do what’s right for partners, customers, and colleagues.


* **Embrace a Growth Mindset:** Embrace a culture of continuous learning, education, and professional development.


* **Drive Solutions:** Demonstrate ingenuity and skill by sharing ideas and solutions that drive our mission forward.


### **About Bloom**


Bloom is a third-party insurance services provider that partners with Medicare health plans to enable high-quality Medicare enrollment and drive earlier health plan activation. Founded in 2007, Bloom has partnered with national and regional payers to implement solutions for every step of the member journey, from telesales and quote & enroll to health activation outreach. Supported by its Ascend technology platform, Bloom produces closer connections and better outcomes for Medicare beneficiaries and health plan stakeholders to deliver High Value Enrollment.

title: Sales Development Representative (Remote)
description:
### **What We Do**


We’re a marketing software company that serves small business owners, primarily financial advisors, and insurance agents. About 40,000 small businesses use our tools to build websites and send out our content. Generally, these businesses don’t have marketing departments but are growth-minded enough to know they need to market themselves.


We help them do just that. We work together to create beautiful website designs, automated marketing tools, and award-winning educational content for them. The end goal is to help them build better relationships with their clients with less hands-on effort.

### **About Our Culture**


FMG started over a decade ago and now has 300+ (and growing!) employees spread out across the globe. We embrace a fast-paced, results-oriented culture, and focus on a healthy work/life balance. We value collaboration and open, thoughtful communication. We believe work should be both engaging and challenging, mixed with a good sense of humor.


Our goal is to invest in motivated, successful individuals and watch them succeed both inside and outside of work. We’re building a winning team of A+ players and we hope you’ll be next to join us.

### **Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion**


At FMG, we believe in the wholehearted acceptance of each other regardless of our differences. We strive to foster an environment that allows everyone to contribute to our mission in their unique ways. With the belief that diversity propels innovation, we are continually finding ways to cultivate a commitment to diversity and inclusion in our employees, services, and products, as well as in the communities in which we live and work.

### **Our Employee Benefits**


FMG strives to be a top-tier employer. We continually evaluate our benefits and total compensation packages to ensure we offer our employees the most competitive package we can provide.

* Generous paid Holiday schedule with a paid Winter Holiday Shutdown week
* Comprehensive paid time off policies including vacation, sick, parental, and bereavement leave.
* Robust Insurance Plan including:
	+ Medical with $0 co-pay Telehealth plan
	+ Dental
	+ Vision
	+ Health Savings Account (HSA) with generous employer contributions
	+ Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
	+ Company-paid Life Insurance and Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) coverage
	+ Company-paid Short & Long Term Disability coverage
	+ Company-paid Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Matching 401(k) with immediate full vesting
* Employee Events Committee that plans fun in-person and virtual events
* On Demand Pay - allows access to a portion of your earned wages prior to the payday with same day deposit
* Internet & Gym Reimbursement!
* Work computer equipment is provided to help you succeed :)

### **About the Role**


Our dynamic Sales team is looking for individuals to join our Sales Development Representative (SDR) team who can work with “New” prospects and warm leads setting appointments for our Senior Account Executive team. SDR’s will help us increase the appetite for our products to Financial & Insurance professionals by demonstrating the benefits of our award winning products and services that help take our clients businesses to the next level. You will experience our inspiring team spirit on a daily basis, as you play a key role in helping our clients reach their professional goals. This is a unique opportunity to gain valuable experience on the front line of the sales process, paving the way for new sales opportunities while working with a tight-knit team that loves to win and have fun. Success in this role can lead to additional sales career advancement along with financial growth.

**Compensation** This position offers $40,000 a year with OTE of $55,000-$65,000 a year.

### **Primary Responsibilities & Expectations**

* Develop opportunities through cold-call prospecting, email promotions & follow up on leads
* Utilize HubSpot to ensure activities are documented
* Prospect to C-Level Financial Advisors and Insurance Agencies
* Maintain a working knowledge of company products
* Create rapport, credibility & build trust based relationships
* Be resilient & persistent
* Attend Sales training and team meetings
* Responsible for achievement of sales goals/targets
* Comply with company policies and procedures
* Access to a private & secure workspace, free from distractions
* Accessible during the assigned work schedule for regular duties and responsibilities as outlined by the supervisor
* An internet connection with speeds of 5 Megabits down / 3 Megabits up (5mbps/3mbps)

### **Skills and Qualifications**

* Excellent oral & written communication skills
* Eagerness to learn, take direction & incorporate feedback into work
* Highly motivated with the ability to interact with professionals
* Knowledge of standard business applications such as G Suite, Slack, Salesloft etc is a plus
* Basic computer knowledge is a MUST. Understanding how computers work and how to use them. This may include but is not limited to; typing, learning keyboard shortcuts/commands, powering a computer on and off, knowing how to connect and disconnect from the internet and learning the systems FMG uses to communicate with customers and internal employees.
* CRM (HubSpot or equivalent) experience, a plus
* Self-confident, self-motivated, driven, organized and solution oriented


FMG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, and genetic information. If you require accommodation to complete the application or interview process, please contact peopleteam@fmgsuite.com.


You can find out more about what it’s like to work at FMG, by visiting https://fmgsuite.com/about-us/

title: Outside Sales Representative - Denver
description:
**THE COMPANY:**
This position is with Money Mailer, a part of the Marketing.com family of companies. Money Mailer is focused on providing consumers with the best local savings, supporting our clients with effective marketing solutions, and helping our franchisees grow their operations. With 30+ production facilities in the US and Canada (and growing!), Marketing.com creates cool things including total marketing communications through printed material, comprehensive digital marketing services, warehousing & fulfillment, sign manufacturing & fabrication, and promotional products.
**JOB SUMMARY:**  

The Company’s projected growth has created the need for talented, experienced, and goal driven sales executives throughout the United States. Reporting to the Corporate Market Sales Manager, the sales executive will generate local ad sales in markets where the company maintains corporate circulation. The primary focus of the executive will be to generate local shared mail, digital product suite, and postcard sales in assigned territory. The person we are seeking will be an aggressive, committed, and results-oriented individual who can follow a proven system and follow our proven system.  

  

The position requires sales experience and a proven track record selling to small and medium-sized businesses with advertising experience preferred. He/she must possess highly effective communication skills with the ability to build rapport with their prospects and clients.
**Position is remote but candidate needs to be located in Denver, Colorado area.**  

  

**ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**
* Achieve assigned sales objectives by effectively executing the Company’s sales process including the generation of leads, following up on leads provided, and following the established sales process and methodology.
* Complete daily activities necessary including cold-calling and prospecting to achieve sales targets which include prospecting, sales presentations, receivable collections, and artwork design.
* Maintain and expand database of prospects in Salesforce.
* Participate in product training sessions, meetings, skills training and professional development classes.
* Complete normal business reports as required.
* Other duties as assigned


**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:**
* 2-year college degree or equivalent is preferred.
* 1 plus years of relevant work experience is preferred.


  

**PREFERRED SKILLS:**
* Ability to cultivate relationships, establish rapport and develop credibility with customers.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, self-directed entrepreneurial environment.
* Good verbal and written communication skills
* Highly proficient level computer skills including MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook
* Experience using a CRM tool.
* Ability to effectively coach, lead, manage and mentor team members.
* Must be a self-starter and able handle a workload with multiple priorities
* Must be able to thrive under pressure in a fast-paced environment


**Our Company offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including but not limited to medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short & long-term disability, 401k, PTO, and Company-paid holidays.**
**We’re an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national**

title: Executive Vice President, Commercial Sales and Customer Engagement
description:
**Position Summary**


The Executive Vice President, Commercial Sales and Customer Engagement is responsible for leading a high-performing sales team and all aspects of the sales process, achieving FFF Enterprises Gross Sales and Net Sales financial objectives. Utilizing diverse commercial selling models, this Executive Leader is accountable for generating profitable sales growth across the entire FFF Enterprises portfolio, deploying programs, services, and solutions in existing and new business segments, and committed to cultivating an inclusive, high-achieving, and forward-thinking culture within the sales function, aligned with FFF Enterprise’s organizational values.


The Executive Vice President, Commercial Sales and Customer Engagement will lead all phases of sales and provide visionary guidance, leadership, coaching, and developmental oversight to direct reports, while routinely assessing of the sales force structure and skill set to align with present and future needs of FFF Enterprises and our customers.


Key accountabilities include but are not limited to: in-depth understanding of the P&L, sales budget and compensation, sales promotional cycle planning and prioritization, cross functional development and implementation go-to-market (GTM) strategies, development of FFF Enterprises value propositions at the product, category, and portfolio level, leading FFF Enterprises customer engagement strategy, developing business cases for high-value customer negotiations, leading Pricing Steering Council (PSC), establishing sales performance expectations and measurements, and overseeing all phases of talent development.


This role serves as a member of the Commercial Leadership Team and requires significant collaboration with the Executive Leadership Team. Key relationships and collaboration in the Commercial Organization will include members of Business Development & Trade, Portfolio Management & Contract Operations, Customer Marketing & Sales Training, Sales & Customer Engagement, Customer Experience & Communications.

**Essential Functions and Duties**

* Achieve sales and financial targets; meet/exceed sales quotas (unit sales), gross sales, and net sales. Accountable for sales force compensation and operating expenses through the budgeting and financial review process. Serve as a key contributor in the development of strategic/tactical initiatives and value propositions to ensure short and long-term objectives and financial targets are achieved and aligned with FFF Enterprises.

Budget Management and Resource Allocation; effectively lead the sales budgeting process via monthly business planning process and forecasting models.


QBR: Champion Quarterly Business Review with internal and external customers.


PSC: Develop and lead Pricing Steering Committee to evaluate pricing proposals and customer/category discounts impacting FFF's value proposition and profitability.

* Leadership and Coaching for Improved Performance: provide vision, leadership, coaching and development, and oversight to direct reports and sales teams. Responsible for recruitment, selection, retention, and motivation of the sales team, including ongoing review of talent and performance management, while building bench strength for future growth. Responsible for working cross-functionally with Executive Leadership and Commercial Leadership Team to effectively deliver FFF Enterprises value proposition to current and future customers (internal/external).
* Execution of Sales Call Excellence and Exceptional Customer Experience: lead the design, development, and execution of the sales call for the sales force. Provide clear communication to ensure direction is efficiently cascaded throughout the sales function; alignment of resources and effective implementation of an integrated commercial model to drive portfolio sales and exceed customer expectations. Lead the customer engagement strategy designed to strengthen FFF Enterprises customer connection and operationalize the utilization of customer insights (i.e. voice of the customer) to inform the strategic and tactical planning process. Execute a coordinated value proposition to maintain/grow existing customers and gain new customers.
* Lead all phases of sales planning: in partnership with CLT, lead the development of annual sales and resourcing planning. Foster an accountability structure that is aligned with FFF portfolio selling model within the sales team that ensures positional priorities are aligned to maximize promotional efforts. Support Portfolio Management, Contract Operations, Strategic Accounts, and Corporate Accounts to develop actions required to pull-through contract platforms.
* Communication: define plans to ensure proactive communication on all aspects of sales force performance. Includes, but is not limited to, monthly KPI reporting and qualitative assessment of the sales call, and routine sales force interaction (at all levels). Lead the National Sales Meeting (NSM) process in partnership with Commercial Leadership Team.
* Best-in-class resources; collaborate with Analytics, Portfolio Marketing, Corporate Marketing, and Customer Marketing to design and develop best-in-class materials and resources to support multi-channel customer engagement (in person and virtual/digital). Ensure optimal portfolio positioning, messaging, and pull-through to maximize customer engagement. Effectively leverage all commercial platforms and offers to accelerate sales.
* Adheres specifically to all company policies and procedures, Federal and State regulations, and laws.
* Display dedication to position responsibilities and achieve assigned goals and objectives.
* Always represent the Company in a professional manner and appearance.
* Understand and internalize the Company’s purpose.
* Display loyalty to the Company and its organizational values.
* Display enthusiasm and dedication to learning how to be more effective on the job and share knowledge with others.
* Work effectively with co-workers, internal and external customers and others by sharing ideas in a constructive and positive manner; listen to and objectively consider ideas and suggestions from others; keep commitments; keep others informed of work progress, timetables, and issues; address problems and issues constructively to find mutually acceptable and practical business solutions; address others by name, title, or other respectful identifier, and respect the diversity of our work force in actions, words, and deeds.
* Comply with the policies and procedures stated in the Injury and Illness Prevention Program by always working in a safe manner and immediately reporting any injury, safety hazard, or program violation.
* Ensure conduct is consistent with all Compliance Program Policies and procedures when engaging in any activity on behalf of the company. Immediately report any concerns or violations.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Education, Knowledge, Skills, and Experience**

**Required Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or life science is required.
* Advanced degree in business, marketing or life science is preferred.

**Required Experience:**

* At least fifteen (15) years’ combined leadership, sales, and marketing experience.
* Results driven and track record of developing high-performing/high-achieving sales teams.
* Experienced in leading multi-layered and national sales organizations.

**Required Skills:**

* Agile, nimble executive leader with ability to lead change.
* Analytical, budgeting, and financial analysis skills. In-depth understanding of P&L management.
* Capability to provide leadership and direction in a fast-paced and complex environment.
* Strong executive presentation, business case development & communication skills.
* Ability to develop relationships with key stakeholders and influence those involved in making major decisions that impact assigned markets.

**Core Competencies:**

* **Business Acumen**: understands assigned markets; knowledgeable in current and future customer segments, practices, trends, and information affecting the business and organization; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.
* **Decision Quality & Balanced Judgment**: Makes sound business decisions based upon a mixture of data analysis, experience, and market insight. Demonstrated track record of accuracy when judged over time; seeks insight and alternative viewpoints from internal peers & colleagues.
* **Innovation & Problem Solving**: Ability to identify which creative ideas and suggestions will work and successful at bringing the creative ideas of others to the forefront. Capable of facilitating effective brainstorming and projecting how potential ideas may play out in the marketplace.
* **Strategic Agility**: understands organizational vision, can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately. Has broad knowledge and perspective, is future oriented, can assess risks & opportunities when developing strategies and executing plans.
* **Leadership**: can establish clear direction & priorities; set stretch objectives; presents work in a well-planned and organized manner; maintains two-way dialogues with others; brings out the best in people. Communicates a compelling and inspired vision or sense of core purpose; is optimistic; creates milestones to rally support behind the vision; makes the vision sharable by everyone; can inspire and motivate teams.
* **Presentation Skills**: effective in a variety of formal & informal presentation settings, one-on-one, small and large groups, with leadership, peers, direct reports and customers.

**Physical requirements**


Vision, hearing, speech, movements requiring the use of wrists, hands and/or fingers. Must have the ability to view a computer screen for prolonged periods and the ability to sit for extended periods. Must have the ability to work the hours and days required to complete the essential functions of the position, as scheduled. The employee occasionally lifts to 20 lbs. and occasionally kneels and bends. Must have the ability to travel occasionally. Working condition include normal office setting.

**Mental Demands**


Learning, thinking, concentration and the ability to work under pressure, particularly during busy times. Must be able to pay close attention to detail and be able to work as a member of a team to ensure excellent customer service. Must have the ability to interact effectively with co-workers and customers, and exercise self-control and diplomacy in customer and employee relations’ situations. Must have the ability to exercise discretion as well as appropriate judgments when necessary. Must be proactive in finding solutions.

**Direct Reports**


TBD

**EEO/AAP Statement**


FFF Enterprises/Nufactor is an equal opportunity employer to all and prohibits discrimination and harassment based on the following characteristics: race, color, caste, religion, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition (including cancer and genetic conditions), genetic information, marital status, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, age (40 years and over), sexual orientation, veteran or military status, medical leave or other types of protected leave (requesting or approved for leave under the Family and Medical Leave Act or any state protected leaves), domestic violence victim status, political affiliation, reproductive health decision-making, and any other characteristic protected by state or federal anti-discrimination law covering employment. These categories are defined according to Government Code section 12920. The Company prohibits unlawful discrimination based on the perception that anyone has any of those characteristics or is associated with a person who has or is perceived as having any of those characteristics.

title: Inside Sales Representative
description:
**We offer paid training, weekly pay (commission pay included), growth opportunity, and much, much more!**

Turf Badger, one of the fastest-growing and highest-rated pest and lawn care companies in Appleton/Green Bay/Marquette/Escanaba, is looking for an experienced, self-motivated and highly organized inside sales professional to join our team. A major perk of this position is that you won’t have to spend all your time making cold calls to people who may not be interested in pest control services. Instead, you’ll be reaching out to warm leads who are either current customers or prospects who have contacted us first over the phone or online. Additionally, you’ll have the opportunity to generate even more business by following up with leads and customers to upsell them on our other pest and lawn care services. What does all of this mean for you? Well, in a nutshell, it means that rather than having to fight to keep people on the phone, you’ll be able to share comprehensive, accurate information about our services while educating them about our commitment to keeping their home and family safe from unwanted pests. That’s because to us, it’s never about pushing the sale. It’s about providing our customers with outstanding service and peace of mind that they can rely on for many years to come.

We offer a regular Monday-Friday schedule, paid training, a competitive base salary and numerous opportunities to earn commission, making Turf Badger a pretty awesome place to work. Want to be part of a locally owned company that’s poised for exponential growth across our region? Looking for a workplace that’s fast paced but laid back at the same time? Interested in challenging yourself to grow personally and professionally every day? We’d love to talk with you about joining the Turf Badger family.

**Requirements** (select all that apply, or add additional):

* Previous sales experience preferred
* Ability to work a regular Monday-Friday schedule
* Must be comfortable spending most of your time communicating with clients
* Be highly organized with strong attention to detail
* Ability to prioritize and multitask
* Demonstrate a strong work ethic
* Ability to learn quickly and take on new responsibilities
* Have excellent judgment and independent thinking skills
* Be a self starter who can anticipate and solve problems
* Have strong interpersonal skills

**Benefits:**

* 401(k) with 3 percent company match
* Paid time off and paid holidays (for W2 employees)
* Paid training opportunities

**About us**

Turf Badger is a rapidly expanding, highly rated company that has been providing comprehensive pest and lawn care services to homeowners in Michigan and Wisconsin since 2020. From our office staff to our field technicians, our entire team is dedicated to providing the best customer service in the industry. Whether we’re handling an insect infestation or tackling a rodent problem, our goal is to give our customers the peace of mind that comes with knowing their home is safe and pest free. And with our ironclad money-back guarantee, it’s no wonder that we’re one of the most trusted names in pest control in our region.

At Turf Badger, we believe that an opportunistic mindset combined with a commitment to honesty and integrity are the keys to success. We strive to uphold our values with a company culture that supports creativity, personal and professional growth and success while encouraging a strong work-life balance.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Work from home

Experience level:

* No experience needed

Shift:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental pay types:

* Bonus opportunities
* Commission pay

Weekly day range:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* Office
* Remote

Work Location: Remote

title: Remote Inside Sales Representative
description:
**Pay Philosophy**
The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.

 **Description****We are currently hiring for Inside Sales Agents in the state of Oklahoma.**

 **Why Liberty Mutual?**


Positivity. Flexibility. Determination and a persuasive personality. Qualities like these cannot be taught. But they can be sharpened, strengthened, and appropriately compensated when you join Liberty Mutual Insurance as a part of our Contact Center Sales Organization. Bring your unique talents to our Fortune 100 company and receive paid-training, licensing in all 50 states, and a dynamic role that directs only warm leads your way (no cold calls) – because we believe in supporting your success, not holding it back. Join our team and realize the rewards of a career with unlimited earning potential, uncapped commissions, and a portfolio of benefits that start on day one.

 **Job Details**


As an Inside Sales Agent you will be handling inbound calls or leads, consulting with customers on their insurance needs and match the correct coverages, products, and benefits to convert leads into customers. In this role you will interact with our customers through warm inbound calls.

 **You’d** **be a great fit if you are:**

 **A Passionate Seller: When** a lead comes in, you skillfully pick up the phone and use your sales expertise to turn prospects into happy, confident Liberty Mutual customers.

 **A Front Lines Liaison:** You rise to the role of representing the Liberty brand, you believe in what you’reselling, and you enjoy connecting customers to the right products for their individual needs.

 **A Reliable Teammate:** Whether you work at the office or from home, you adapt well to different environments, schedules, and the varying needs of our customers.

 **A Customer-Centric Closer:** While “sales” is in your title, integrity is in your nature. That means you sincerely care that our customers get exactly the quality products and services they need to embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow.

 **Pay Details:**

* Starting base salary during training is $45K with opportunity for growth.
* Average earnings range from $55K-$75K through a combination of base salary and generous commission.
* Top Performing Agents in their second year and onward, can earn up to $85k+.

 **Position Details:**


From day one you will begin paid training in a remote work environment. All insurance representatives need to hold a Property & Casualty Insurance license. If you do not have one, no worries, paid training also includes licensing!

* All computer equipment is provided.
* Training extends over a period of 16 weeks for licensed hires and 18 weeks for unlicensed hires.
* Comprehensive medical benefits from Day 1.
* No cold calls, all incoming warm leads.
* Opportunities for rewards and recognition.
* Must be available to work a schedule of 4 weekdays and 1 weekend day with a mid-morning start time. Example 11am-8pm (CST).
* You can expect to work this schedule for a minimum of 12 months before consideration for another shift.

**Qualifications*** At least 1 year of experience in sales and customer service
* An engaging, outgoing personality and passion for helping customers
* Ability to communicate well to both prospects and customers
* Excellent analytical, decision-making and organizational skills
* Strong typing capabilities and PC proficiency

**About Us**
\\*\\*This position may have in-office requirements depending on candidate location.\\*\\*

  

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.

  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG’s Insider Pro and Computerworld’s 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-equity-inclusion/

  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits

  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.

**Fair Chance Notices**

* California
* San Francisco
* Los Angeles
* Philadelphia

title: Account Executive
description:
**Account Executive - Programs Division**
-----------------------------------------

**Widelity** is seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented **Account Executive** to join our dynamic Programs Division. In this role, you will play a vital part in developing and managing client relationships, driving new business opportunities, and ensuring the successful delivery of our services. Reporting to the Senior Manager, you will be responsible for owning your pipeline and executing strategies to expand our customer base, enhance brand visibility, and maximize revenue generation. This is a **full-time**, **100% remote position** with some anticipated travel.

**About the Programs Division:**


The Programs Division provides a comprehensive suite of services to assist clients with navigating the complexities of government funding. We offer expertise in various areas, including:

* Business technology consulting
* Grant writing and management
* Research
* Regulatory services
* Compliance
* Funding consulting

**Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain strong relationships with prospective and established clients, understanding their unique needs and challenges.
* Proactively identify and qualify new business opportunities, generating leads and converting them into closed deals.
* Manage the entire client lifecycle relationship, from initial contact through onboarding, project execution, and post-project support.
* Serve as a trusted advisor to clients, providing expert guidance and support throughout the grant application and management process.
* Collaborate and communicate effectively with internal teams, including program managers, subject matter experts, and operations personnel, to ensure seamless project delivery.
* Contribute to the development and execution of strategic marketing and sales initiatives for the Programs Division.
* Maintain a deep understanding of relevant government funding programs, regulations, and compliance requirements.
* Prepare and deliver compelling presentations and proposals to showcase our capabilities and value proposition to clients.
* Exceed client expectations by delivering exceptional service and exceeding agreed-upon goals.
* Oversee and maintain your sales funnel, with the ability to report on relevant metrics in a timely fashion using our existing CRM and other tools as necessary.
* Meet and exceed revenue targets and other goals, adhering to established KPIs.
* Participate in market research to aid in business development efforts and stay updated on industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging opportunities.
* Maintain an unwavering commitment to asset protection and cybersecurity.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum 3 years of experience in sales, business development, account management, or a related field, preferably in the professional services industry.
* Proven track record of success in exceeding sales targets and achieving revenue goals.
* Strong grasp of sales methodologies (e.g. MEDDIC/MEDDPICC, Challenger, SPIN, etc.) is preferred.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with clients at all levels and work cross-functionally with internal teams and other departments.
* Comfortable engaging with prospects at the senior management level, including Director, VP, and C-suite, with the ability to command the conversation.
* Strong understanding of the government funding landscape and its associated processes.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Demonstrated ability to problem-solve and navigate complex situations.
* Proficiency in Google Workspace and CRM software.

 **Attributes Necessary for Success in this Role:**

* Client focus
* Results-oriented
* Excellent communication
* Enthusiastic
* Strong analytical skills
* Time management
* Collaborative
* Problem-solving
* Willingness to take risks
* Empathetic
* Coachable
* Adaptable
* Intellectually curious

**Compensation and Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* On-target earnings: $80-160k (base + commission), commensurate with experience.
* Benefits include: PTO, paid holidays, healthcare, investments, work-from-home stipend, and bereavement pay.
* Opportunity to work in a dynamic and growing industry
* Collaborative and supportive work environment
* Potential for professional development and career advancement

 **Travel Expectations:**

* Around 25% travel on average, but will fluctuate depending on sales activities.
* Expected to call on clients, attend trade shows and conferences, and attend relevant meetings in-person as necessary.

**About Widelity:**


Widelity is an employee-owned small business with a rich history of serving Fortune 500 companies, mid-size businesses, startups, and government agencies including the US Senate, the FCC, and the Department of Justice. We are committed to providing our clients with innovative solutions and exceptional service, and helping them achieve their strategic objectives. Widelity provides a full range of technology consulting services, with four major lines of business:

* **Programs Division** which includes business technology consulting, grant writing and management, research, regulatory services, compliance, and funding consulting services.
* **Custom Wireless Division** which includes design and installation of complete wireless coverage in building and outdoor environments.
* **Network Strategy Division** which includes Engineering Assessments, Technology Planning and Execution, and Next Gen Optimization and Integration
* **National Security Division** which includes tailored security solutions, Technology Scouting, custom integration, and training

**Join our team and make a difference!**

**Please note:**

* This is a full-time, remote position.
* The qualifications listed above are not exhaustive, and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

**WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**


At Widelity, we welcome differences and celebrate new ideas. We believe the diversity of our people inspires our creativity and drives our innovation. Everyone is welcome here, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.  

We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation due to a disability for any part of the employment process, please email compliance.recruiting@widelity.com.

title: Remote Call Center Fiber Sales
description:
**Who we are:**



We are SP Data Digital, and we like to shake things up! We promote a great culture and embrace a team of entrepreneurs who think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We work hard and encourage innovation. We are THE Customer Service source for our partners, and we provide support for some of the industry leaders in Telecom, Finance, Technology, and Security! For more information on SP Data Digital, visit our website at https://www.spdatallc.com/about.

  

**What we offer:**


* Fully remote role
* Fully paid training
* Hourly wage of $15 USD + uncapped bonus potential
* Full-time position – 40 hours per week!
* Opportunity for growth and development
* Employer-sponsored benefits


**The job:**



As an **Outbound Fiber Sales Advisor**, you will:


* Make outbound calls to current customers needing to switch from traditional copper lines to fiber
* Ask probing questions to understand the customer's needs and listen for sales cues
* Handle objections by explaining how the services and products will benefit the customer
* Track all sales activities in the company CRM system and keep current by updating prospect information
* Meet and/or exceed monthly quotas.


**You are a great fit if you have:**


* 1+ years of sales experience, preferably Fiber sales
* Extensive knowledge of Fiber and Cable/DSL services and the differences between them
* 6 months + experience in a call center environment
* Experience with handling objections
* A hunger to earn a higher income in a bonus sales environment
* Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
* Strong computer skills, with the ability to multi-task using a wide range of software applications and programs.
* Currently residing in and legally able to work in the United States


This position requires the use of one's personal computer with our Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) platform. Successful applicants will need their own personal Windows 10/11 device *(Unfortunately our remote work software will not work on Macs or Chromebooks at this time)*. The device will need to be able to connect directly to your modem with an ethernet cord for a secure connection. It should have a minimum of 8 GB RAM. Webcam required.



**SP Data Digital is an Equal Opportunity Employer**: We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.
